0: (Reuters) - Digital Ally Inc forecast full-year revenue of about $22.5 million, encouraged by a "five-fold" rise in inquiries for its wearable cameras from police departments in the aftermath of the fatal shooting in Ferguson this month. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The forecast translates into a 26.4 percent jump in revenue from $17.8 million in 2013. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The fatal shooting of an unarmed black teenager in Ferguson, Missouri, sparked demand to hold law enforcement officials accountable and in turn fueled interest in companies such as Digital Ally and Taser International Inc. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The company's 2014 revenue forecast was first reported by USA Today on Thursday, citing Chief Executive Stanton Ross, according to a regulatory filing on Friday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Digital Ally said on Thursday it had received its first camera order after the Ferguson incident from the Michigan police department. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The company's shares closed at $18.66 on Friday on the Nasdaq.
